Package be.geertvanderpijpen.thinkinginjava.exercises.controlexecution

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    BinaryPrintShift
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Using integer variables, 31 shifts are done and at each time showing the results in binary form
    2 shifts are done 31 unsigned right shifts of 1 bit on a number that has a 1 in the most significant bit (in this case Integer.MIN_VALUE) 31 unsigned right shifts of 1 bit on the number -1
    CompareRandoms
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    A random number is generated.
    CompareRandomsInifinte
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    A random number is generated. 25 other random numbers are generated and at each time compared to the first number
    This process is repeated ad infinitum
    Beware, this program invokes an infinity loop
    DetectPrimes
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Detects all primes up until 1000
    This is done by 2 nested for loops
    Fibonacci
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Prints a Fibonacci sequence of n lenght, where n is passed as argument to the class
    InRange
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Determines for differenat test values and ranges if the test value is in the specified range
    OneToHundred
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Prints all values of 1 to 100 with a for loop
    OneToHundredBreak
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Prints all values of 1 to 100 with a for loop
    The program breaks at value 99
    SwitchInFor
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Demonstrates the use of switch in a for loop
    A switch statement is used that tests on 3 integer values.
    VampireNumbers
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Finds all 4-digit vampire numbers
    Vampire numbers are numbers that
    Have an even number of digits Have the same digits as 2 numbers of half their digits Those numbers must multiply to form the Vampire numbers
